title.narrative: Yes I Do - Zambia

description.narrative: The goal of YID programme is for adolescent girls to decide if, when and whom to marry and if, when and with whom to have children with, and are protected from FGM/C. The alliance uses multiple strategies to reach this desired impact, namely: social mobilization, meaningful engagement and empowerment of young people; improved SRH information and services; improved access to education and economic opportunities and dialogues
Generation Alive YID Zambia first 50% 2017 grant
Generation Alive YID Zambia first 50% 2017 grant
Generation Alive Zambia grant YID 2018 part 2
Generation Alive Zambia YID 2017 second tranche 50%
Generation Alive Zambia YID 2018 first tranche 50%
this number is an estimation yet to be settled

title.narrative: Meaningful Youth Participation Tool Report Zambia 2017
Survey report MYP Zambia 2017
Goal 2. Adolescent girls and boys are meaningfully engaged to claim their SRH rights
(qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in girls and boys between 15 and 24 years old who feel they can advocate for themselves

description.narrative: Semi-structured in-depth interviews with girls aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years. And focus group discussions with groups of girls aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and groups of boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all Girls and boys seem to have little capacity to advocate for themselves.

Girls and boys seem to have some capacity to advocate for themselves especially the youth involved in the Champions of Change and other youth clubs. However the voice of youth in general community meetings is still limited.

title.narrative: Goal 2. Adolescent girls and boys are meaningfully engaged to claim their SRH rights
(qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in girls and boys between 15 and 24 years old who feel they can advocate for themselves

description.narrative: Semi-structured in-depth interviews with girls aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years. And focus group discussions with groups of girls aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and groups of boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all Girls and boys seem to have little capacity to advocate for themselves.

Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all There are some observed changes to young people's agency and capacity to speak out. Some participants spoke about improvements in intergenerational communication. Others said it was still difficult to discuss issues with adults. A conservative culture remains and young peoples' self-expression is mostly shaped by their outward appearance and hardly by contributing in for example community meetings which seems to limit self-expresions and agency.

comment.narrative: In Zambia besides training the partner organisations MYP capacity building focused on local organizations and community members of which 91 participated in an MYP training (not included in this number but in indicator PW2.CZ4).

CSOs are involving young people in their programming in a meaningful way
Perceived change among young people who experience that their contribution was meaningful and valued

description.narrative: Survey conducted among young people about meaningful youth participation. For report see https://aidstream.org/files/documents/YID-MYP-SURVEY-REPORT-ZAMBIA-2017-20180831090803.pdf

comment.narrative: Perceived level of meaningful youth participation score 1-5 (1=not present 2=present to a low extent 3=somewhat present 4=present to a high extent 5=present to a high extent).

Mechanisms are in place to ensure meaningful youth participation (MYP) in implementing organisations.

description.narrative: Meaningful Youth Participation Tool conducted by YID organizations. For report see https://aidstream.org/files/documents/MOT-analysis-Zambia-2017-20180831090827.pdf

comment.narrative: Present level of meaningful youth participation score 1-5 (1=not present 2=present to a low extent 3=somewhat present 4=present to a high extent 5=present to a high extent).

title.narrative: Goal 2. Adolescent girls and boys are meaningfully engaged to claim their SRH rights
% boys aged 15-24 who can decide for themself whom to date and go out with

description.narrative: A community-based cluster sample survey was administered at the household level among young girls and boys aged 15-24 in the intervention areas (Chadiza&Petauke) and control area (Katete). The survey included question about child marriage. We obtained a sample size of 1434 using a standard formula- taking into account possible design effects because of the clustered sampling- we multiplied the required sample by 1.5 and had a ratio of 75% female respondents and 25% male respondents. A total of 1455 questionnaires were administered.

title.narrative: Goal 2. Adolescent girls and boys are meaningfully engaged to claim their SRH rights
% boys aged 15-24 who can decide for themself whom to date and go out with

description.narrative: A community-based cluster sample survey was administered at the household level among young girls and boys aged 15-24 in the intervention areas (Chadiza&Petauke) and control area (Katete). The survey included question about child marriage. We obtained a sample size of 1434 using a standard formula- taking into account possible design effects because of the clustered sampling- we multiplied the required sample by 1.5 and had a ratio of 75% female respondents and 25% male respondents. A total of 1455 questionnaires were administered.
